title: 'I keep someone on the backburner' Katie Price reveals she has a man in reserve in case her relationship breaks down
text:

Katie Price has confessed she keeps a man on the “backburner” in case her relationships don’t work out. 
The Loose Women panelist - who has been married three times - admits she prefers to have a boyfriend than be single. 
And her plan to keep a man involves having someone lined up when she thinks the romance is fizzling out. 
Speaking about staying friends with exes during a panel discussion on Loose Women, she said: “Normally mine have ended messy or for good reasons I've split from them. 
“I normally know when a relationship is going to end, because you get that eggshell-y feeling, where you go home and you think, 'Oh, am I going to say something wrong?' I hate that. Read More Katie Price keeps a man on the backburner (Photo: ITV) She made the confession on Loose Women (Photo: ITV) 
"But most of the times, I’ve usually got someone on the backburner so then I'm not on my own. 
“Not in every single relationship, but if I have split from someone and then I haven't got someone lined up, I'm like, 'Oh, I've got to find someone.' ” 
Katie – who is married to Kieran Hayler, with whom she has son Jett, three, and Bunny, two – doesn’t think former lovers can ever be great friends, because ultimately one person will still harbour feelings. 
But the former glamour model admits it is important to stay on good terms with your ex when there are kids involved. Read More She doesn't like being single (Photo: ITV) She's currently married to Kieran Hayler (Photo: Rex Features) 
However, she confessed it hasn’t been easy to do that with her ex-husband Peter Andre – who she has son Junior, 11, and daughter Princess, nine. 
Katie – who was also briefly wed to cage fighter Alex Reid – said: “You're either going to split or not, all this stuff about going to dinner and stuff how's that going to work? 
“One person is always going to want more than the other, it's rubbish, I just don't get it. Don't have dinner and go on holiday together … Life isn't a rehearsal, I thought I had that fairy tale with Pete, but I didn't."
